query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

result.title: Practice Abstracts II
result.description: The resulting innovative knowledge and easy accessible enduser material from this project should feed into the EIPAGRI website for broad dissemination The enduser material to be produced contains a substantial number of summaries for practitioners in the EIP common format practice abstracts including the characteristics of the project eg contact details of partners etc A full package of practice abstracts is needed for the project containing all the outcomesrecommendations which are ready for practiceA practice abstract is a short summary of around 10001500 characters word count no spaces which describes a main informationrecommendationpractice that can serve the endusers in their daily practice The set of practice abstracts needs to be submitted as a deliverable in the project and in the EIP common format to EIP the policy and project officerThe guidance to be followed for these practice abstracts and some explanatory text and examples from ongoing projects are available on the EIPAGRI web site httpeceuropaeueipagricultureencontenteipagricommonformatA total target number of 13 practice abstracts is foreseen for the project

result.title: Atlas and field guide for different permanent grassland types in Europe
result.description: A European Permanent Grassland Atlas with distribution of the different PG types across EuropeThis will be supplemented with short illustrated descriptions of the 20-25 types (similar to “Grasslands in Europe”19 and LIFE and Europe’s grasslands43), based on pedo-climatic conditions, yield level, management, and simple vegetation characteristics that allow in-field identification of PG types by stakeholders. The Atlas could be presented as an electronic image, hard copy map and/or GIS layer at appropriate resolution (to be decided). It is possible that the GIS layer could be presented at different resolution or spatial scale depending on the amount of information available in each part of Europe.
